newsitem.title: YEMEN: Fourth Yemen party to boycott April elections.
newsitem.headline: Fourth Yemen party to boycott April elections.

text.p: Yemen's Popular Forces Union Party said in a statement on Wednesday it was boycotting next month's parliamentary elections to protest against alleged irregularities in voter registration .

The main internal opposition party, the Yemen Socialist Front (YSP) and two others have already announced a boycott of the April 27 elections, the first since a civil war in 1994 nearly tore apart the Arab world's poorest country.
The YSP won 50 seats in the outgoing assembly, dominated by the General people's Congress (GPC) of President Ali Abdullah Saleh and its junior coalition partner the Islamist Islah Party.

"The results of the elections have already been decided... after the GCP and Islah agreed in advance how they will divide the seats in the chamber through agreement on constituencies," said Yemen's Popular Forces Union Party in the statement.
"And this would also lead to a division of power between them after the vote," it added in a statement.
It said that together with seven others in an opposition alliance it failed to get official guarantees the ballot would be fair and free.
The party has support among intellectuals and reformers but has no seats in parliament.
The opposition claims the government has already fixed the election results through multiple registrations by army and security personnel.
Election officials expect about 5,000 candidates to seek votes for 301 parliamentary seats under the banners of 12 parties or as independents in the vote.
Saleh on Saturday invited international observers to monitor the vote.
